intro: Pedicularis pseudomelampyriflora, commonly known as the false flame violet, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant features showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, with a distinctive spurred shape. Its leaves are opposite and often covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in cool, moist environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in specialized gardens.
